summary: Letters to the Girls I've Loved
title: Letters to the Girls I've Loved
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GsJdn8

by Mantabel

Ben Solo is 16 and still trying to grow into his body. He’s the tallest boy in his class with thick black locks, long limbs, big nose and ears who is hard to miss. Though seemingly intimidating on the outside, Ben is a true romantic at heart. In an old shoebox under his bed, he had 5 love letters that were never meant to be sent out. Now that they are, Ben has to come up with a solution in order for his secret not to be fully exposed. Rey Jackson, a girl who got one of his letters, has an idea. Fake date her.

Words: 3348, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Sequel Trilogy, To All the Boys I’ve Loved Before (2018)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/F, F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Ben Solo, Rey (Star Wars), Poe Dameron, Armitage Hux, Phasma (Star Wars), Finn (Star Wars), Rose Tico, Paige Tico, Han Solo, Chewbacca (Star Wars), Lando Calrissian, Luke Skywalker, Unkar Plutt
  • Relationships: Rey/Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Poe Dameron/Armitage Hux, Phasma/Paige Tico, Finn/Rose Tico, Leia Organa/Han Solo
  • Additional Tags: Teen Romance, Teen Angst, romcom, Inspired tatbilb, Reylo - Freeform, Gingerpilot, finnrose - Freeform, everyone is either 16 or 17, Ben and Rey are the same age., Slow Burn, teenage love story


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GsJdn8

summary: For Amidala - Redrikki - Star Wars - All Media Types [Archive of Our Own]
title: For Amidala - Redrikki - Star Wars - All Media Types [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Star Wars - All Media Types, Star Wars Prequel Trilogy
Rating: General Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Padmé Amidala/Sabé, Padmé Amidala & Naboo Royal Handmaiden(s), Padmé Amidala/Naboo Royal Handmaiden(s)
Characters: Naboo Royal Handmaiden(s), Padmé Amidala, Sabe
Additional Tags: Identity Porn, Girls Kissing, Assassination Attempt(s)
Summary:

Her handmaidens had all poured so much of themselves into Amidala, it was like they were part of her now. Padmé didn’t know if she had the strength to let one go.

summary: Triple Force Friday Announced | StarWars.com
title: Triple Force Friday Announced | StarWars.com
excerpt: The next generation of Star Wars products arrives in our galaxy this fall.
description:
THE NEXT GENERATION OF STAR WARS PRODUCTS ARRIVES IN OUR GALAXY THIS FALL.

Let the countdown begin.

Triple Force Friday, the latest in a tradition of Star Wars product launches, is set for October 4, Lucasfilm and Disney announced today. The event will see the debut of brand-new products inspired by three of the year’s biggest Star Wars releases, including:

  • The highly anticipated, final installment of the Skywalker saga, Star Wars: Episode IX
  • The first-ever Star Wars live-action series, The Mandalorian, set to debut exclusively on the upcoming streaming service, Disney+.
  • The latest title from EA and Respawn — Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order — a brand-new action-adventure game releasing holiday 2019

Products spanning categories from toys to collectibles, housewares, books, apparel, and more will go on sale beginning at 12:01 a.m. on October 4. As with past Force Friday celebrations, stores around the world will join the festivities with in-store events and midnight openings.

Stay tuned to StarWars.com for more on Triple Force Friday!

  • The highly anticipated, final installment of the Skywalker saga, Star Wars: Episode IX
  • The first-ever Star Wars live-action series, The Mandalorian, set to debut exclusively on the upcoming streaming service, Disney+.
  • The latest title from EA and Respawn — Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order — a brand-new action-adventure game releasing holiday 2019

Products spanning categories from toys to collectibles, housewares, books, apparel, and more will go on sale beginning at 12:01 a.m. on October 4. As with past Force Friday celebrations, stores around the world will join the festivities with in-store events and midnight openings.

Stay tuned to StarWars.com for more on Triple Force Friday!

summary: The Porgs Nest wants to hear from you!
body:
The Porgs Nest wants to hear from you!

As @reysexualkylo and I gear up to record our next episode we want to gather up your questions and or comments about anything and everything Star Wars! You can absolutely ask on anon we do not mind one bit. So if you have something on your mind, please share! You can send an ask here on Tumblr to me or @reysexualkylo, or you can email theporgsnest@hotmail.com. At the end of episode three, we will do a q&a. Can’t wait to hear from you!! 💜

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

summary: 2019's Force Friday will launch 'Star Wars' — and 'Frozen' — merchandise
title: 2019's Force Friday will launch 'Star Wars' — and 'Frozen' — merchandise
body:
Force Friday is coming back for thirds, and this time Olaf, Elsa, and Anna are getting in on the action.

Disney has staked out Friday, Oct. 4 as the day it will unleash its wave of new Star Wars and Frozen products worldwide.

In the past, Disney and its merchandising minions have staked out Force Friday as the kick-off to Star Wars hysteria, serving the dual strategy of building hype for the latest Episode and launching holiday shopping sprees for 2015’s Star Wars: The Force Awakens and 2017’s Star Wars: The Last Jedi. With the Mouse House’s ridiculously stacked release schedule this year, the hugely anticipated finale to Star Wars‘ central Skywalker Saga (arriving Dec. 22) will share the lucrative season with the hugely anticipated Frozen 2 (out Nov. 22).

Technically Oct. 4 is being billed as two separate events for the different fandoms. “Triple Force Friday” will not only include toys, games, books, apparel, collectibles, housewares and other merch based on Star Wars: Episode IX, but also on the upcoming live-action series The Mandalorian, which will be the vanguard of the Disney+ streaming service, whose launch date has yet to be announced. Aside from an assortment of action figures and ships from the likes of Hasbro and Lego, EA will release its latest video game, Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order.

Arendelle aficionados, meanwhile, will be celebrating Frozen Fan Fest. As opposed to 2014, when the original Frozen became a full-fledged phenomenon but Disney and its merry band of merch makers were caught flat-footed and didn’t have enough product to feed the demand, 2019 will be fully stocked. Disney promises “product reveals, musical moments, in-store events and much more, introducing an unprecedented assortment of Frozen 2 product.” Disney will continuing staging Frozen-themed events through the season.

Watch the teaser trailer for Frozen 2:

Read more from Yahoo Entertainment:

  • Here’s the ‘Frozen 2’ teaser trailer: Easter eggs, mystery characters and startled fan reactions
  • ‘Star Wars Galaxy’s Edge’: Everything we know about Disney’s new theme park land
  • ‘The Mandalorian’: Everything we know about the ‘Star Wars’ live-action series
